questions.prompt: A memoryless system's output at time t depends on:
questions.explanation: A memoryless system has output at time t that depends ONLY on the input at that same time t. No past or future values influence the current output.
x(t+1) means the output at time t depends on the input at t+1 (the future). This makes the system non-causal.

questions.prompt: For a linear system, if T{x₁}=y₁ and T{x₂}=y₂, then T{x₁+x₂}=?
questions.explanation: Linearity requires additivity: T{x₁+x₂} = T{x₁} + T{x₂} = y₁ + y₂. This is the superposition principle.
Squaring violates homogeneity: T{2x} = (2x)² = 4x² ≠ 2·x². Since 4x² ≠ 2x², the system is nonlinear.
The coefficient t changes with time, so the system's behavior changes over time. This makes it time-varying.

options: Bounded input always produces bounded output
questions.correctAnswer: Bounded input always produces bounded output
questions.explanation: BIBO = Bounded Input, Bounded Output. If every bounded input produces a bounded output, the system is BIBO stable.
Adding a constant violates additivity: T{0} = 3 ≠ 0. For a linear system, zero input must give zero output.

questions.prompt: Which property does an LTI system have?
questions.explanation: LTI = Linear Time-Invariant. By definition, an LTI system possesses BOTH linearity AND time-invariance.
Integration from -∞ to t means the output depends on ALL past values of the input. This gives the system memory.
Absolute value violates homogeneity: T{-x} = |-x| = |x| ≠ -|x|. So it's nonlinear. But output only depends on current input, so it's causal.
